/*
Create a class Calculateinvestment .
Create a class Testmain. In Test main, create object for class Calculateinvestment and
call the method of this class in Testmain.
Read in investment amount, annual interest rate, and number of years from the user
and display output
the future investment value using the following formula:
futureInvestmentValue =
investmentAmount * (1 + monthlyInterestRate)numberOfYears*12
For example, if you enter amount 1000, annual interest rate 3.25%, and number
of years 1, the future investment value is 1032.98.
Here is a sample run:
Enter investment amount: 1000.56
Enter annual interest rate in percentage: 4.25
Enter number of years: 1
Future value is $1043.92


*/


// The class containing "main" method should be placed first
import java.util.*;
public class main {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
      System.out.println("Hello, World!");
  }
}

Read in investment amount, annual interest rate, and number of years from the user
and display output
the future investment value using the following formula:
futureInvestmentValue = investmentAmount * (1 + monthlyInterestRate)numberOfYears*12
For example, if you enter amount 1000, annual interest rate 3.25%, and number
of years 1, the future investment value is 1032.98.

Here is a sample run:
Enter investment amount: 1000.56
Enter annual interest rate in percentage: 4.25
Enter number of years: 1
Future value is $1043.92

*/


// The class containing "main" method should be placed first
import java.util.*;
public class main {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
      System.out.println("This will tell you the future value of your investment!");
      calculateInvestment calculateInvestmentObj = new calculateInvestment();
  }
}

==+==
FILE: calculateInvestment.java
==+==

public class calculateInvestment {
  public static void calculateInvestment(String args[]){
    System.out.println("Enter t")
    investmentAmount
    annualInterestRate
    numYears
    futureInvestmentValue
  }
}

/*
Scarlett Grimes
CMP SCI 2261
Homework 1

Instructions (copied and pasted from canvas):

Create a class Calculateinvestment.
Create a class Testmain. 
In Test main, create object for class Calculateinvestment and
call the method of this class in Testmain.
Read in investment amount, annual interest rate, and number of years from the user
and display output
the future investment value using the following formula:
futureInvestmentValue = investmentAmount * (1 + monthlyInterestRate)numberOfYears*12
For example, if you enter amount 1000, annual interest rate 3.25%, and number
of years 1, the future investment value is 1032.98.

Here is a sample run:
Enter investment amount: 1000.56
Enter annual interest rate in percentage: 4.25
Enter number of years: 1
Future value is $1043.92

*/


// The class containing "main" method should be placed first
import java.util.*;
public class main {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
      System.out.println("This will tell you the future value of your investment!");
      calculateInvestment calculateInvestmentObj = new calculateInvestment();
  }
}

==+==
FILE: calculateInvestment.java
==+==

public class calculateInvestment {
  public static void calculateInvestment(String args[]){
    System.out.println("Enter the amount invested (exclude $): ")
    investmentAmount
    annualInterestRate
    numYears
    futureInvestmentValue
  }
}
